Signature image  
Digital version of the cardholderâ€™s signature

ssl_original_time.description:
Original transaction time  
The date of the original transaction.   
**Format**: HHMMSS

ssl_original_date.description:
Original transaction date  
The time of the original transaction.  
**Format**: HHMMSS

ssl_reference_number.description:
Transaction reference number  
Unique transaction reference number returned in the authorization response message of the original transaction

ssl_tip_amount.description:
Tip or gratuity amount  
Amount to add or update to the transaction amount.    
Set to 0.00 to reset or remove the original tip amount.  
The last and most current tip sent will be processed as the tip amount.  
**Format**: Number with 2 decimal places.

ssl_server.description:
Server ID  
Unique identifier of the clerk, waiter, waitress or cashier.  
Send if updating the server ID of the existing transaction.

ssl_shift.description:
Shift ID  
Unique identifier of the time period, course or service type  
Send if updating the server ID of the existing transaction.

Update_Tip.title: Update Tip
Update_Tip.description: Use only on terminals that are set up with the Market Segment set to *Service*.

ssl_tip_amount.description:
Tip or gratuity amount  
Amount to add or update to the transaction amount.    
Set to 0.00 to reset or remove the original tip amount.  
The last and most current tip sent will be processed as the tip amount.  
**Format**: Number with 2 decimal places.

ssl_server.description:
Server ID  
Unique identifier of the clerk, waiter, waitress or cashier.  
Send if updating the server ID of the existing transaction.

ssl_shift.description:
Shift ID  
Unique identifier of the time period, course or service type.  
Send if updating the server ID of the existing transaction.

ssl_verify_tip.description:
Account verification indicator  
Indicates whether the online incremental authorization for tip adjustment is performed.     
- Y - Perform online incremental authorization for tip adjustment.  
**Important:** Only applicable to authonly transactions  
- N - Do not perform online incremental authorization for tip adjustment

ssl_cardholder_tip_amount.description:
Amount to add or update when Converge processes the original transaction as a Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) transaction and that the authorized amount is in the cardholderâ€™s currency.  
To reset or remove the original tip amount from a DCC transaction, set the value to 0.00.  
**Format:** Number with 2 decimal places  
**Important:** Only applicable to terminals set up for the Service market segment and with the Dynamic Currency credit payment option.

ssl_auth_lifecycle_indicator.description:
Authorization lifecycle indicator  
Indicates the life cycle of the authorization.  

- 0 - No time period specified
- 1 - Days
- 2 - Hours
- 3 - Minutes

ssl_auth_lifecycle_duration.description:
Duration of authorization lifecycle  
Valid values:  
- 00-99  
Important: 00 is the equivalent of no hold being placed.

ssl_sys_trace_audit_no.description:
System trace audit number  
Used by the POS to uniquely identify the transaction to the host. This is used in the MAC calculation.

ssl_processing_code.description:
Processing code  
Types of Canadian debit transaction:  
- 000000 - Debit purchase from the default account (flash only)
- 001000 - Debit purchase from savings
- 002000 - Debit purchase from checking
- 091000 - Debit purchase with cashback from savings
- 092000 - Debit purchase with cashback from checking
- 200000 - Debit return from the default account (flash only)
- 200010 - Debit return from savings
- 200020 - Debit return from checking
- 220000 - Void of a debit purchase from the default account (flash only)
- 220010 - Void of a debit purchase from savings
- 220020 - Void of a debit purchase from checking
- 020000 - Void of a debit return from the default account (flash Only)
- 021000 - Void of a debit return from savings
- 022000 - Void of a debit return from checking

ssl_mac_value.description:
Message authentication code  
Verifies that the Canadian debit message was not altered when transferred over a telecommunications network.

ssl_icc_isr.description:
Issuer script results  
Describes the results of the terminal script processing.

ssl_icc_tsi.description:
Transaction status information  
- A - Accepted
- E - Error detected

ECS_Paper_Check.title: ACH Paper Check
ECS_Paper_Check.description: Uses a check reader device to capture data.

ssl_micr_data.description:
Unformatted Magnetic Ink Character Recognition (MICR) data  
The exact MICR line from the check including the spaces and symbols. Replace the symbols with the following letters:  
- T - Transit symbol
- O - On-US symbol
- A - Amount symbol
- D - Dash symbol

ssl_check_image.description:
Check image  
Scanned and encoded image of the check.

ssl_drivers_license_number.description:
Drivers license number  
Unique identification code as it appears on the license.  
**Important**: Required for guarantee transactions.

ssl_drivers_license_phone_number.description:
Phone number  
Contact number (includes the area code) as it appears on the license.  
**Important:** Required for guarantee transactions.

ssl_drivers_license_state.description:
State code  
State code as it appears on the license.  
**Important**: Required for guarantee transactions.

ssl_track_data.description:
Raw track I and/or II data    
Track data captured from the cardâ€™s magnetic stripe. The data includes beginning and ending sentinels, cardâ€™s expiry date, cardholderâ€™s first and last name.

ssl_ksn.description:
Key Serial Number    
Unique identifier generated from the swiped payment card and returned by the encrypting device. The KSN encrypts the PAN data through the DUKPT method.

ssl_enc_track_data.description:
Encrypted raw track I and/or II data 
Encrypted Track I and/or II data captured from the cardâ€™s magnetic stripe when using an encrypting device. The data includes beginning and ending sentinels, cardâ€™s expiry date, cardholderâ€™s first name and last name.

ssl_ksn.description:
Key Serial Number    
Unique identifier generated from the swiped payment card and returned by the encrypting device. The KSN encrypts the PAN data through the DUKPT method.

ssl_dcc_token.description:
See XML - emvdcccheck for the EMV DCC process.
ssl_dcc_token is required for an EMV transasaction to process as DCC.
ssl_dcc_token will part of the response for eligible DCC cards from transaction type EMVDCCCHECK.
ssl_dcc_token has a 15 min time limit from creation. After that time you will receive a 4017 error.

Advanced_Integration_Settings.title: Advanced Integration Settings
Advanced_Integration_Settings.description: Optional advanced integration settings. These elements should be defined with caution - only for advanced integrators.

ssl_pin_entry_capability.description:
Pin entry capability


This value is used to indicate the capability of the terminal to capture a PIN. 
Valid values:
- 0 - Unknown
- 1 - Can accept and pass an online PIN
- 2 - Cannot accept and pass an online PIN
- 3 - Can accept and pass an online PIN (mPOS - Software Based)
- 8 - PIN Pad is not functional

ssl_terminal_type.description:
Terminal type


This value is used to indicate the type of POS device used at the point of authorization.  
Valid values:
- 00 - Attended Terminal
- 01 - Limited Amount Terminal (CAT)
- 02 - Unattended Terminal (ATM)
- 03 - Unattended Terminal (CAT)
- 04 - No Terminal Used
- 05 - Mobile Device
- 09 - Unknown

ssl_cat_indicator.description:
CAT indicator


This value is used to indicate the type of Cardholder Activated Terminal (CAT) indicator for this transaction. 
Valid values:
- 00 - Not a CAT Transaction
- 01 - Limited Amount Terminal
- 02 - Automated Dispensing Machine
- 03 - Self-Service Terminal (AFD)
- 04 - In-Flight Commerce
- 05 - Internet
- 06 - Transponder
- 07 - Remote Indicator

ssl_elavon_token_indicator.description:
Elavon token indicator


This field is used to identify if the data in the account data field contains a token replacement value instead of the original account data.
Valid values:
- 0 - No Elavon token used
- 1 - The data in the account data field is an Elavon defined token value

ssl_association_token_indicator.description:
Association token indicator


This field is used to identify if the data in the account data field contains an association defined token replacement value instead of the original account data.
Valid values:
- 0 - No association token used
- 1 - The data in the account data field is an association defined token value

ssl_mpos_acceptance_device.description:
mPOS acceptance device


This value is used to indicate the type of mobile device used for an mPOS transaction.
Valid values:
- 0 - Dedicated mPOS terminal with PCI compliant dongle (with or without key pad)
- 1 - Off the shelf mobile device (Phone, Tablet, etc.)
- Space - Not an MPOS Device

ssl_cit_mit_cof_indicator.description:
Consumer Initiated (CIT) or Merchant Initiated (MIT) Credential on File transaction indicator 

 
Identifies if the transaction is a Consumer Initiated (CIT) or a Merchant Initiated (MIT) Credential on File Transaction
 Valid values:
- 000 - Not a Consumer Initiated or Merchant Initiated Credential on file transaction
- C01 - Consumer Initiated Credential On file (Ad-hoc)
- C02 - Consumer Initiated Standing Order
- C03 - Consumer Initiated Subscription
- C04 - Consumer Initiated Installment
- M01 - Merchant Initiated Unscheduled Credential On file (Ad-hoc)
- M02 - Merchant Initiated Standing Order
- M03 - Merchant Initiated Subscription
- M04 - Merchant Initiated Installment
- M05 - Merchant Initiated Partial Shipment
- M06 - Merchant Initiated Related/Delayed Charge
- M07 - Merchant Initiated No Show Charge
- M08 - Merchant Initiated Re-Submission

Debit_Straight_Send_Match.title: Debit card straight send match
Debit_Straight_Send_Match.description: Lowers the risk when processing original credit transactions by matching account name inquiry criteria, full name, partial or better match or no match.

ssl_first_name.description: First name on the cardholder's / customer's account or billing address.

ssl_last_name.description: Last name on the cardholder's / customer's account or billing address.

ssl_middle_name.description: Middle name on the cardholder's / customer's account or billing address.

ssl_name_verification.description:
- ANVF - Approves only if the account name is completely matched
- ANVP - Approves if the account name is partially matched   
- ANVN - Approves even if the name is matched or not

ssl_transaction_type.description: Type of transaction provided in request

ssl_result.description:
Transaction outcome  
An ssl_result = 0 indicates an imported batch file.  
An ssl_result not equal to 0 indicates a declined and unauthorized transaction.

ssl_issuer_response.description:
Original issuer response  
The issuer response returned during the authorization attempt.  
An ssl_issuer_response = 00 indicates success.  
An ssl_issuer_response = 85 indicates no reason to decline.  
An ssl_issuer_response = 10 or 11 indicates partial success.  
An ssl_issuer_response not equal to 00, 10, 11, or 85 indicates a decline or failure.

ssl_txn_id.description:
Transaction ID  
Unique identifier of the transaction.

ssl_txn_time.description:
Processing date and time  
Indicates when Converge processed the transaction.  
Format: MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss AM/PM  
Example: 03/18/2010 10:34:10 AM

ssl_approval_code.description:
Transaction approval code  
Unique code returned by the credit card processor that indicates the approval status of the transaction.

ssl_card_number.description: Card number as it appears on the card.

ssl_card_short_description.description:
Short card brand name  
Valid values:  AMEX, CUP, DISC, MC, PP, VISA

ssl_promo_list.description:
Promotion list  
This contains a list of all promo products; the data for each promo product will be nested and embedded between beginning and ending elements ssl_promo_product up to 5 promo products. Each promo product ssl_promo_product will contain ssl_promo_code, ssl_promo_code_name, ssl_promo_code_description, and ssl_promo_code_issue_points.

ssl_par_value.description: Payment Account Reference (PAR) from original auth

Token_Response.title: Response - Token
Token_Response.description: Returned only if tokenization parameters are sent in the request.

ssl_token.description:
Token  
Generated from the credit card number.  
Returned if transaction was approved.  
Not returned if the transaction was failed or rejected.

ssl_token_provider.description:
Credit card token provider  
This code indicates the provider for the token. This value is also visible in the Converge UI.  
Valid values:  
- P for legacy tokens  
- V for Voltage tokens

ssl_token_response.description:
Token generation outcome  
A value of SUCCESS indicates Converge generated the token. Other values returned are FAILURE, Action Not Permitted, Invalid Token, Not Permitted, and Acct Verification Failed.

ssl_add_token_response.description:
Add to card manager outcome  
Valid values:  
- Card Added
- Card Updated
- Not Permitted 
- FAILURE - First Name - is required

ssl_association_token_data.description:
Association token indidcator 
Used to identify if the data in the account data field contains an association defined token replacement value instead of the original account data.  
Valid values:  
- 0 - No association token used  
- 1 - The data in the account data field is an association defined token value

ssl_brand_token_eligibility_indicator.description:
Identifies if the transactions is eligible for the brand tokenization services  
Valid values:  
- 1 for token program  
- Space for not applicable

ssl_account_number.description:
Masked account number  
Converge only returns the first and last 4 digits of the actual account number.

ssl_exp_date.description:
Card's expiry date    
Date when the card becomes invalid.

ssl_customer_id.description:
Customer ID  
Merchant-defined unique customer identifier.

ssl_first_name.description:
First name  
First name on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_last_name.description:
Last name  
Last name on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_avs_address.description:
Address line 1  
Commonly the house number and street name on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.  
Address Verification Service (AVS) data compared with the address on the card issuerâ€™s file.  
Recommended for hand-keyed transactions to qualify for better interchange rates.

ssl_address2.description:

Apartment or condominium unit number and floor number on the cardholderâ€™s or customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_state.description:
State code  
State or province code on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_avs_zip.description:

ZIP code on the cardholderâ€™s account or billing address.  
(AVS) data compared with the postal or ZIP code on the card issuerâ€™s file.  
Recommended for hand-keyed transactions to qualify for better interchange rates.   
Recommended if ssl_verify = **Y**.

ssl_company.description:
Company name  
Company name on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_country.description:
Country ISO code  
Country ISO code on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_email.description:
Email address  
The cardholderâ€™s or customerâ€™s email address.

ssl_phone.description:
Phone  
Phone number on the cardholderâ€™s / customerâ€™s account or billing address.

ssl_description.description:
Merchant-defined transaction description  
Short and custom text to describe the transaction.

Tip_Response.title: Response - Tip
Tip_Response.description: Returned only if Tip parameters are sent in the request.

ssl_base_amount.description:
Base amount  
Original transaction amount sent in the request. Returned based on the terminal setup.

ssl_tip_amount.description:
Tip amount  
Added or updated tip or gratuity amount. Returned based on the terminal setup.

Merchant Advice Code (MAC) response for MasterCard transactions

- M03 - Do not try again (MasterCard)  
- M21- Payment Cancellation (MasterCard)

DCC_Response.description: Returned only if the terminal is set up with the dynamic currency credit card payment option.

ssl_txn_currency_code.description:
Transaction currency code  
The cardholderâ€™s billing currency code.

ssl_markup.description:
Markup  
The markup applied to the reference exchange rate when calculating the ssl_conversion_rate value to use for converting the merchantâ€™s pricing currency to ssl_txn_currency_code.

ssl_conversion_rate.description:
Conversion rate  
Exchange rate applied to the conversion of ssl_amount.

ssl_dcc_rate_provider.description:
Currency rate provider  
the entity that provided currency exchange rate.

ssl_cardholder_amount.description:
Cardholder amount  
Total amount in the cardholderâ€™s billing currency.

ssl_cardholder_base_amount.description:
Base amount  
Base amount in the cardholder currency. Returned only if tip processing parameters are sent in the request.

ssl_cardholder_tip_amount.description:
Amount to add or update when Converge processes the original transaction as a Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC) transaction and that the authorized amount is in the cardholderâ€™s currency.  
To reset or remove the original tip amount from a DCC transaction, set the value to 0.00.

EMVDCCCHECK_Response.title: Response - EMVDCCCHECK
EMVDCCCHECK_Response.description: Returned only if the terminal is set up with the dynamic currency credit card payment option.

ssl_conversion_rate.description: Exchange rate applied to the conversion of ssl_amount.

ssl_dcc_exponent.description: The number of exponent digits in the DCC Rate.

ssl_cardholder_amount.description: Total amount in the cardholderâ€™s billing currency.

ssl_markup.description: The markup applied to the reference exchange rate when calculating the ssl_conversion_rate value to use for converting the merchantâ€™s pricing currency to ssl_txn_currency_code.

ssl_dcc_rate_provider.description: The entity that provided currency exchange rate.

ssl_dcc_token.description: A token that will allow you to process DCC for EMV transaction types. This token is good for 5 minutes.

EMVKEYEXCHANGE_Response.title: Response - EMVKEYEXCHANGE
EMVKEYEXCHANGE_Response.description: Returns a collection of public keys associated to EMV applications.

ssl_transaction_type.description: EMVKEYEXCHANGE

ssl_emv_key_date.description: EMV key date from the host month+day+year

emv_key_collection.description:
A collection of emv_key elements 
Parent element of the emv_key collection.

rid.description: value is used to identify the specific application system on the POS device

public_key_index.description:
Public key index
Indicates the public key in conjunction with the RID.

hash_id.description:
Hash ID
Identifier of the hash algorithm used to produce the hash results in the digital signature scheme.

signature_id.description:
Signature ID
Identifier of the digital signature algorithm used with the public key.
Value:  01 - Default

public_key_length.description:
Public key length
A public key element used to confirm the size of the public key in the cryptography process.

exponent.description:
Exponent
The value of the exponent part of the public key.

checksum.description:
Checksum
A check value calculated on the concatenation of all parts of the public key.

ICC_Response.title: Response - ICC (chip card)
ICC_Response.description: Properties returned by EMV Chip authorization.

ssl_icc_issuerscript.description:
Issuer Script
A script returned by the issuer to be provided to the ICC card.

ssl_icc_csn.description:
Card Sequence Number
Differentiates multipe card data that use the same Primary Account Number (PAN)

ssl_icc_atc.description:
Application Transaction Counter
Incrementing counter value managed by the application in the chip card.

ssl_icc_arpc.description:
Issuer Authentication Data 
Contains the data sent to the chip card for online issuer authentication.

PartialApproval_Response.title: Response - Partial Approval
PartialApproval_Response.description:
Returned only if partial approval parameters are sent in the request.  
If the customer indicates that they do not wish to continue with the additional tender type, the point of sale application must send a reversal to cancel this payment and reestablish the balance back to the card.  
A reversal can be achieved by sending a ccdelete in terminal-based terminals or ccvoid in host-based terminals.

ssl_requested_amount.description:
Requested amount  
Original requested amount on partial approvals.

ssl_balance_due.description:
Remaining balance  
The difference between the requested amount and the authorized amount, which the merchant will collect from the customer.

ssl_account_balance.description:
Account balance   
Available balance on the card, which is 0.00 for a partially authorized transaction.

CardOnFile_Response.title: Response - Card on File
CardOnFile_Response.description: Returned only if Card On File parameters are sent in the request.

ssl_oar_data.description:
Original Authorization Response (OAR) data  
This data will be as received during the original authorization processing.  
This is a retain and return value for terminal-based settlement messages.  
You may store this field with the payment details from the transaction to make future Card On File transactions.

ssl_ps2000_data.description:
PS2000  
This data will be as received during the original authorization processing.  
This is a retain and return value for terminal-based settlement messages.  
You must store this field with the payment details from the transaction to make future Card On File transactions.

Error_Response.title: Response - Error
Error_Response.description: Returned only if an error occurs.

errorCode.description:
Error code  
Typically, when the transaction failed validation or the request is incorrect. This will prevent the transaction from going to authorization. This is a numeric field.

errorMessage.description:
Error message  
Detailed explanation of the error. This field may be changed based on merchant configuration in the user interface.

errorName.description:
Error name  
Error name or reason for the error.

GiftCard_Response.title: Response - Gift Card
GiftCard_Response.description: Returned only if Gift Card parameters are sent in the request.

ssl_account_balance.description:
Account balance   
Available balance on the card, which is 0.00 for a partially authorized transaction.

ssl_egc_tender_type.description:
Tender type
Tender type used to pay for the gift card.
Valid values:
- 0 - Cash
- 1 - Credit card
- 2 - Debit card
- 3 - Check

ssl_email.description:
Email address  
The cardholderâ€™s or customerâ€™s email address.

ssl_exp_date.description:
Card's expiry date    
Date when the card becomes invalid.

ssl_security_code.description:
Card security code  
Unique verification code assigned to the cardholderâ€™s gift card account.

fundingSource.description:
Funding source  
Indicates whether this card is using credit or debit as a funding source.  
Possible values:  
- C - Returned if the card is a credit card.
- D - Returned if the card is a debit card.

ssl_amount.description:
Total authorized/approved transaction amount  
The base amount for a transaction.

ssl_credit_surcharge_percent.description:
Credit surcharge percent   
The percentage of the amount in ssl_amount applied as a surcharge.

ssl_credit_surcharge_amount.description:
Credit surcharge amount  
The amount in USD added to ssl_amount as a surcharge.

ssl_total_amount.description:
Total amount  
The total of ssl_amount + ssl_credit_surcharge_amount

accountRequestStatus.description:
Account status  
Identifies if the account owner's name match is performed by the issuer or not, or if it is not supported. 
- Spaces - Not Applicable
- 00 - Name match performed
- 01 - Name match not performed
- 02 - Name match not supported

cardNumber.description:
Card number  
Card number field. This field is specific to binlookup operations.

debit.description:
Debit check  
Shows whether the card was a debit card.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card is a debit card.
- N - Returned if the card is not a debit card.

pinless.description:
Pinless supported  
Shows whether the card supports pinless transactions.  
- Y - Returned if the card supports pinless transactions.
- N - Returned if the card doesnâ€™t support pinless transactions.

hsa.description:
Health savings account linked  
Shows whether the card is linked to a health savings account.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card is linked to a health savings account.
- N - Returned if the card is not linked to a health savings account.

billPaymentSupport.description:
Bill payment support  
Shows whether the card supports online bill payment.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card supports online bill payment.
- N - Returned if the card does not support online bill payment.

businessCard.description:
Business card support  
Shows whether the card supports L2, which includes customer codes and sales tax.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card supports L2.
- N - Returned if the card does not support L2.

CountryCode.description:
Country code  
Returns the ISO country code for the card.  
This field is specific to binlookup operations.

dbIntechFraudInd.description:
Regulated with fraud  
Indicates whether this card is regulated with fraud.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card supports regulated with fraud.
- N - Returned if the card does not support regulated with fraud.

ecommSupport.description:
Ecommerce supported  
Indicates whether this card supports online, one-off transactions.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card supports eCommerce.
- N - Returned if the card does not support eCommerce.

internationalSupport.description:
International tranactions support  
Indicates whether this card supports international transactions.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card supports international transactions.
- N - Returned if the card does not support international transactions.

networkRoutingCode.description:
Network routing code  
Indicates the processor network for a card.  
If this result returns Elavon, the card is a credit card. Otherwise, the card will return the debit network the card transaction was routed over.

prepaidSupport.description:
Prepaid support  
Indicates whether the card is a prepaid card.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card is a prepaid card.
- N - Returned if the card is not a prepaid card.

signatureSupport.description:
Signature supported  
Indicates whether this card supports debit signature with no PIN.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if the card supports debit signature with no PIN.
- N - Returned if the card does not support debit signature with no PIN.

surchargeAllowed.description:
Surcharge allowed  
Indicates whether a credit surcharge can be applied to this card.  
Possible values:  
- Y - Returned if a credit surcharge can be applied to this card.
- N - Returned if a credit surcharge cannot be applied to this card.

cardProductTypeCode.description: Code indicating the card product type.

pinlessDebitEnabled.description:
Pinless supported for debit card  
Shows whether the debit card supports pinless transactions.  
- Y - Returned if the debit card supports pinless transactions.
- N - Returned if the debit card doesnâ€™t support pinless transactions.

octeligible.description:
Used to identify if the transaction is eligible for a disbursement as an Original Credit Transaction (OCT).   
Possible values:  
- Y - Transaction is eligible for OCT Disbursement
- N - Transaction is NOT eligible for OCT Disbursement

quickServeSupport.description:
Debit Quick Serve (QSR) indicator without PIN under $50  
This field is specific to binlookup operations.

institutionName.description:
The issuing bank name for China Union Pay debit cards    
This field is specific to binlookup operations.

firstNameResult.description:
First name result  
Identifies if the first name in the request matches with the file for the account owner's first name. 
- Spaces - Not Applicable
- 01 - First name match 
- 50 - Partial match
- 99 - No match

fullNameResult.description:
Full name result  
Identifies if the full name in the request matches with the file for the account owner's full name. 
- Spaces - Not Applicable
- 01 - Full name match 
- 50 - Partial match
- 99 - No match

lastNameResult.description:
Last name result  
Identifies if the last name in the request matches with the file for the account owner's last name. 
- Spaces - Not Applicable
- 01 - Last name match 
- 50 - Partial match
- 99 - No match

middleNameResult.description:
Middle name result  
Identifies if the middle name in the request matches with the file for the account owner's middle name. 
- Spaces - Not Applicable
- 01 - Middle name match 
- 50 - Partial match
- 99 - No match

TransactionQuery_Response.title: Response - Transaction Query
TransactionQuery_Response.description:
- Converge lists the query result in descending date/time order.
- When the query is based on transaction ID, the query result contains one single unique transaction or lists all the product line items for level 3 transactions.
- When the query is based on a card data parameter, Converge retrieves transactions from the Open and Settled batches that are within the last two months.
- When the query is based on card data and date range parameters, Converge retrieves transactions from the Open and Settled batches that match the specified date range.
- When the query returns more than a single transaction, the detailed response of each transaction will contain the original response along with the transaction status (ssl_trans_status).

ssl_user_id.description:
Converge user ID    
The user ID with hosted payment API user status that can send transaction requests through the terminal.

ssl_txn_id.description:
Transaction ID  
Unique identifier of the transaction.

ssl_txn_time.description:
Processing date and time  
Indicates when Converge processed the transaction.  
Format: MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss AM/PM  
Example: 03/18/2010 10:34:10 AM

ssl_txn_time_utc.description:
Processing date and time in UTC format  
Indicates when Converge processed the transaction.  
Format: MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss

ssl_txn_count.description:
Transaction count  
Number of transactions matching the search criteria.  
Important:  
- Returned when the query is based on card data and/or date range.
- The result can only show a maximum of 1000 unique transactions at one time.
- If there are more than 1000 records in a batch, Converge will return the first 1000 records.

ssl_next_txn_time.description:
Transaction timestamp  
Timestamp of the transaction in the next set when the ssl_txn_count in the batch exceeds 1000.  
Important:  
- Returned when the query is based on card data and/or date range.  
- The point-of-sale application can use this timestamp to request the next set of 1000 transactions.
- Use the next txn time and query for the next 1000 records until all records in the settled batches are retrieved.

ssl_trans_status.description:
Transaction status   
Valid values:  
- PEN - Pended
- OPN - Unpended / release / open
- REV - Review
- STL - Settled
- PST - Failed due to post-auth rule
- FPR - Failed due to fraud prevention rules
- PRE - Failed due to pre-auth rule

ssl_service_fee_txn_time_utc.description:

ssl_settle_time_utc.description:

ssl_settlement_batch_response.description:

ssl_entry_mode.description:

Indicates how the track data was captured.    
**Valid values:**   
- 01 - Manually entered - Card not present 
- 02 - Manually entered - Card present  
- 12 - Manually - Token 
- 03 - Swiped 
- 05 - EMV (ICC) with CVV or iCVV 
- 06 - EMV (ICC) Proximity Read 
- 07 - EMV (ICC) without CVV or iCVV   
- 08 - EMV (ICC) Magnetic stripe read when chip failed to read

XML_EMV_KeyExchange.description:
Requests EMV keys to update the devices. It is performed intitally to get the EMV key when   
- An EMV chip sale (emvchipsale) transaction response returns an `ssl_update_emv_keys` value of 'Y'
- An EMV chip auth only (emvchipauthonly) transaction response returns an `ssl_update_emv_keys` value of 'Y'
- An EMV swipe sale (emvswipesale) transaction response returns an `ssl_update_emv_keys` value of 'Y'

PaymentFields_Response.title: Response - payment field
PaymentFields_Response.description:
- The response contains the root XML beginning and ending element <txn>.  
- Within the <txn> element, section information is presented. Data for each section will be nested and embedded between the beginning element <Section> and the ending element </Section>. There can be more than 1 Section elements.  
- Within each Section element, fields are presented. Data for each field resides between the beginning element <Field> and the ending ending </Field>. There can be more than 1 Field elements.

Name.description: Section name as configured by Converge

DisplayName.description: Section label as configured by the merchant

ShowinVT.description:
Show section under payment menu  
Indicates if the section appears (Y>) or does not appear (N) under the payment menu of the virtual terminal.

ShowOnPaymentForm.description:
Show section on payment form  
Indicates if the section appears (Y) or does not appear (N) on the payment page under the payment menu.

ShowinReceipt.description:
Show section on receipt  
Indicates if the section appears (Y) or does not appear (N) on the receipt.

CustomerEmail.description:
Show customer email in section  
Indicates if the customerâ€™s email address appears (Y) or does not appear (N) in the section.

MerchantEmail.description:
Show merchant email in section  
Indicates if the merchantâ€™s email address appears (Y) or does not appear (N) in the section.

Field.description:
Field data elements  
- Name - Field name
- DisplayName - Field label
- Section - Section in which the field appears.
- FieldType - Data type
- Min - Minimum length
- Max - Maximum length
- Required - Indicates if the field is mandatory (Y) or optional (N)
- ChangedOnPaymentForm - Indicates if the field is editable (Y or non-editable (N) in the payment form of the virtual terminal.
- ShowonPaymentForm - Indicates if the field appears (Y) or does not appear (N) on the payment page.
- ShowinReceipt - Indicates if the field appears (Y) or does not appear (N) on the receipt.
- CustomerEmail - Indicates if the field appears (Y) or does not appear (N) in the customerâ€™s email.
- MerchantEmail - Indicates if the field appears (Y) or does not appear (N) in the merchantâ€™s email.
- ForwardOnApproval - Indicates if the field is forwarded (Y) or not forwarded (N) on approvals.
- ForwardOnDecline - Indicates if the field is forwarded (Y) or is not forwarded (N) on declines.
- SystemField - Indicates if the field is a system field (Y) or a custom field (N).
